summary: Full-stack Internet Computer (Motoko + React) application with Internet Identity authentication, role-based admin access control, public pages (Home, Videos, Contact), and an admin inbox UI; includes RTRKidd dirtbike-themed branding across the site and a Videos page that loads videos from the @RTR.Kidddddd YouTube channel and filters to bike-related content, with build/deploy fixes and guardrails applied to restore successful local run and deployment.

existing_features.description: Backend canister initialized with an authorization/access-control module (MixinAuthorization + access-control) and main canister entrypoint wiring.

existing_features.title: React frontend app scaffold with routing and site layout
existing_features.description: React/Vite/Tailwind frontend with core layout components (SiteLayout, TopNav) and page structure for Home, Videos, Contact, and Admin areas.

existing_features.title: Internet Identity authentication integration (frontend)
existing_features.description: Frontend auth hooks and components to authenticate via Internet Identity and create an authenticated backend actor; includes LoginButton and related auth utilities.

existing_features.title: Admin guard and protected admin inbox page (frontend)
existing_features.description: Admin-only UI route protection and an admin inbox page scaffold for managing inbound contact inquiries/messages.

existing_features.title: Contact page with inquiry success UI (frontend)
existing_features.description: Public contact page UI including a success/confirmation panel component for inquiries.

existing_features.title: Videos page with YouTube helper utilities (frontend)
existing_features.description: Public videos page scaffold and helper library for working with YouTube URLs/IDs.

existing_features.title: Build/deploy template for ICP full-stack app
existing_features.description: Included build template assets for packaging, deploying, and maintaining the full-stack project (workspace configs, scripts, canister configs).

existing_features.title: Generated static branding assets
existing_features.description: Generated hero background and logo images placed under frontend/public/assets/generated.

existing_features.title: RTRKidd dirtbike-themed branding applied across public pages and navigation
existing_features.description: Updated site-wide visual identity and page copy to reflect RTRKidd branding with a dirtbike-themed aesthetic while remaining consistent with Tailwind + shadcn-ui components.

existing_features.title: Updated generated logo and hero background assets are rendered by the frontend
existing_features.description: Frontend now uses the updated generated branding assets (logo + hero background) under frontend/public/assets/generated.

existing_features.title: Profile setup dialog for authenticated users (frontend)
existing_features.description: Frontend includes a ProfileSetupDialog component to support post-login user onboarding/profile setup flow (intended to run after Internet Identity authentication).

existing_features.title: Build/deploy pipeline fixed for end-to-end ICP app (frontend+backend)
existing_features.description: Implemented code/configuration updates across backend, frontend, and the ICP build-template to restore successful builds and deployments (frontend build, Motoko canister build, and deployment script/config alignment).

existing_features.title: Build-time guardrails added to prevent recurring deployment regressions
existing_features.description: Added/updated guardrails in the build-template and frontend tooling (config/scripts/lint rules) to catch common build/deploy pitfalls earlier and reduce chances of repeating the prior deployment failure.

existing_features.title: Videos page loads from @RTR.Kidddddd YouTube channel feed and filters to bike-related videos
existing_features.description: Frontend Videos page fetches videos from the @RTR.Kidddddd channel (via channel feed utilities/hooks) and applies a bike/dirtbike-related filter before rendering.

existing_features.title: Update the frontend to make admin troubleshooting self-serve: when a logged-in user is denied by AdminGuard, display the user’s current Principal (as text) and an English explanation that admin access is based on Internet Identity Principal, not email.
Add an admin-facing UI page to manage admins: list current admins, allow entering a Principal to grant admin, and allow revoking admin from listed Principals (with confirmation).

new_feature_requests.summary: Add an admin-facing content editor to update the homepage/info box text (and similar editable copy) without redeploying

Add a backend admin bootstrap capability: if the canister currently has zero admins, allow the authenticated caller to promote themself to admin via a dedicated update method; if at least one admin already exists, the method must reject with an authorization error.
Add backend admin management endpoints that allow an admin to grant and revoke admin role for a specified Principal, and to list current admins (for use by an admin UI).

architectural_notes: Frontend uses React + Vite + Tailwind with shadcn-ui component library for UI primitives.
Authentication is handled via Internet Identity on the frontend with an actor-based client (hooks) to call the Motoko backend.
Backend includes a reusable authorization/access-control layer (MixinAuthorization + access-control) to support role-based restrictions (e.g., admin-only pages).
Project includes an ICP build/deployment template (canister.yaml, icp.yaml, deploy script, workspace configs) to standardize builds and deployment.

Videos content is loaded client-side from the @rtrkidddddd channel feed using dedicated YouTube channel feed utilities/hooks and then filtered using a heuristic bike/dirtbike-related classifier before display.

Build-template directory now contains a more fully fleshed ICP React (Vite + Tailwind + shadcn-ui) starter, including utility scripts for image resizing/pruning and expanded UI primitives mirroring the app’s component stack.
YouTube channel handle was corrected by the user to @RTR.Kidddddd (was previously captured as @rtrkidddddd).
Build-template was hardened/expanded (scripts, configs, deploy tooling, and UI primitives) to better mirror the app stack and reduce deployment/build breakage risk.
Frontend includes additional lint/build-time guardrails (custom eslint rules and stricter config) to prevent common IC/II integration and query-key pitfalls from breaking builds.
YouTube channel configuration was normalized into dedicated frontend config (youtube.ts) and related feed utilities for consistent handle/identifier usage.
Admin access is role-based and requires explicitly assigning an authenticated Internet Identity principal to an admin allowlist; login alone does not grant admin privileges.
